description: {"blocks":[{"key":"fc085","text":"Silicon (Si) in plant tissues reduces abiotic and biotic stress, but it is incorporated as silica (SiO2), which is difficult to solubilize for analysis. We modified an oven-induced tissue-digestion method to improve Si solubilization and validated the accuracy by quantifying the mass-balance recovery of Si from hydroponic solution and in plant tissues. Leaf, stem, and root tissues were dried, finely-ground, and digested in 12.5 molar sodium hydroxide at 95 °C. The solutions were then acidified with hydrochloric acid to achieve a pH of 2 for measurement of Si using the molybdate blue colorimetric method. Interference of phosphorus (P) in the analysis was minimized by increasing the addition of oxalic acid from 0.6 to 1.1 molar. We recovered 101 ± 13% of the Si in leaf, stem, and root tissues across 15 digestions. This Si recovery was fourteen-fold higher than the standard acid-extraction method and similar to a USDA-ARS alkaline-extraction method. Our procedure offers a low-cost, accurate method for extraction and analysis of Si in plant tissues.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":102,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"9f39k","text":"Triple rinse a 50-mL polyethylene screw-cap centrifuge tube with   sodium hydroxide.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":65,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"6cfpi","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"100","error_concentration":false,"guid":"78F80AE09F3811ED8E15F30353D63DCC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1ho1g","text":"Triple rinse the 50-mL polyethylene screw-cap centrifuge tube with distilled water.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"1br79","text":"Dry the tube and cap with a clean paper towel.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cdgcq","text":"Add about   of dry and ground plant tissue to the tube. Record the exact mass. Ensure all ground tissue is transferred to the bottom of the tube and not stuck on the side.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":10,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"dna7k","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"49D663E09F3A11ED8E15F30353D63DCC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ciira","text":"Add 5 drops of octyl-alcohol to the ground tissue in the bottom of the tube to reduce foaming.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bsfjk","text":"Add   of   hydrogen peroxide to the bottom of the tube. Wash the inside of the tube free from the tissue sample with the hydrogen peroxide as it is added.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"9kclp","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"5E49FC609F3A11ED8E15F30353D63DCC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"30","error_concentration":false,"guid":"620D6D009F3A11ED8E15F30353D63DCC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":206}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1rc57","text":"Tighten the screw cap and place the tube upright (standing inside a 250 mL glass beaker works well)  into a   oven for  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":108,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":119,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"qjht","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"342171C09F3A11ED8E15F30353D63DCC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"95","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"BE17DAA09F3911ED8E15F30353D63DCC","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bnt7p","text":"Preheat an oven to  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":19,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"bh23s","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"43E369109F3A11ED8E15F30353D63DCC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"95","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bnj2a","text":"After  , remove the tube from the oven using heat-safe gloves.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":6,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4hc4j","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":1800,"guid":"6F0A02C09F3A11ED8E15F30353D63DCC","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1rmi9","text":"Inside a fume hood, add   of  sodium hydroxide to the tube. Add the sodium hydroxide slowly to avoid excess foaming.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":24,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":28,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1g0o8","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"4","error":false,"guid":"781009F09F3A11ED8E15F30353D63DCC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"12.5","error_concentration":false,"guid":"C68948E0D08F11ED94B3435737725BBD","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":22}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4ccgh","text":"After 4 hours, remove the tube from the oven using heat-safe gloves.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8ki5b","text":"Gently vortex the tube, replace the cap, and return to the   oven for an additional  .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":59,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":84,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"denmt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"3BCF3BF09F3A11ED8E15F30353D63DCC","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"95","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":14400,"guid":"24E461E09F3A11ED8E15F30353D63DCC","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6u19a","text":"Add   of 5 mM ammonium fluoride to the tube to facilitate the formation of monosilicic acid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"a7e0f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"1","error":false,"guid":"D706E800D41111ED9DCF9585977FDF96","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"effto","text":"Add   of   hydrochloric acid to neutralize the sample. Add the hydrochloric acid slowly to avoid foaming. The solution should turn clear after addition of the acid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":9,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"4i480","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"9","error":false,"guid":"A70E64D0B45D11ED9830113579D1323E","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"6","error_concentration":false,"guid":"5FEF4DE0D09011ED94B3435737725BBD","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":22}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"9klq7","text":"Add distilled water to the tube up to 50 mL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"83pq9","text":"Use deionized water to prepare a 1:25 dilution of the sample with a final volume of   . Place sample into a 10 mL glass vial or test tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":84,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fi12n","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"10","error":false,"guid":"EBFA4EF0D3FD11ED9DCF9585977FDF96","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d8ekg","text":"Dry fresh plant tissue at   for at least  . Water can remain in tissue below   , which increases dry mass, and volatile compounds can be driven off above   , which reduces dry mass.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":26,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":41,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":78,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":155,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"31267B37D09711EDB3D70A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"80","unit":10}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":172800,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"31267BCED09711EDB3D70A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"80","unit":10}},"2":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":172800,"error_temperature":false,"guid":"31267C70D09711EDB3D70A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"scientificNotation":false,"start":null,"temperature":"80","unit":10}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"31267A92D09711EDB3D70A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"80","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2fcpu","text":"Grind dry plant tissue in a mortar and pestle to a uniform, fine powder. Particle sizes should be less than about 0.1 mm in diameter (consistency of fine sand).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7agds","text":"Add 6 drops of   hydrochloric acid to the sample vial. Cap the vial and invert to mix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":15,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"1ukbm","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"6","error_concentration":false,"guid":"B229A120D3FE11ED9DCF9585977FDF96","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":22}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4qjlo","text":"Add 12 drops of   ammonium molybdate. Cap the vial and invert to mix. Wait   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":16,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":75,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"8khgs","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"81","error_concentration":false,"guid":"C92DEF40D40111ED9DCF9585977FDF96","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":28}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"1A6FF720D3FF11ED9DCF9585977FDF96","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3h24u","text":"Add 8 drops of   oxalic acid. Cap the vial and invert to mix. Wait   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":15,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":67,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"doo02","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"1.1","error_concentration":false,"guid":"2D6A8430D3FF11ED9DCF9585977FDF96","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":22}},"1":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":120,"guid":"3B057CD0D3FF11ED9DCF9585977FDF96","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"45uml","text":"Add   of   sucrose and   isoascorbic acid. Cap the vial and invert to mix until solids have dissolved. Wait   .","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":4,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":9,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":23,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":108,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"fv7on","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"981D17E0D40211ED9DCF9585977FDF96","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":5}},"1":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"90","error_concentration":false,"guid":"74D598F0D3FF11ED9DCF9585977FDF96","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":13}},"2":{"type":"concentration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"concentration":"10","error_concentration":false,"guid":"7C4BB150D3FF11ED9DCF9585977FDF96","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":13}},"3":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":300,"guid":"63371632D3FF11ED82E50A58A9FEAC02","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":[],"start":null}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"91c51","text":"If using a LaMotte Smart3 colorimeter, select the Silica - Low Range method. Insert vial into colorimeter to obtain measurement of silica in the sample. If using a spectrophotometer, prepare a calibration curve from 0 to 4 ppm silica and analyze all samples at 650 and 815 nm.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":50,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

warning: {"blocks":[{"key":"7do1r","text":"This procedure utilizes a strong base (12.5 M sodium hydroxide) and a strong acid (6 M hydrochloric acid) for sample digestion and fixing. Gloves and safety goggles are required when handling these chemicals.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":169,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
